quest.name: A Knight's Calling
journal: Now that all the players are assembled, Hilda is eager to get on with it.

Lucia's plan to rescue Ser Aymeric hinges upon luring the bulk of Ishgard's defenders out of the city. Correctly deducing that the revolutionaries have recruited knights in service to the High Houses, she asks Hilda to help by ordering these sympathizers to spread word of a heretic army massing outside the Gates of Judgement. Hilda agrees, but not before cautioning her that the deception will not last long. Ask Lucia what role she has in mind for you.

Although the forces of the High Houses should no longer be a factor, a contingent of Temple Knights and the Heavens' Ward will doubtless remain to guard the archbishop and the imprisoned Ser Aymeric. Therefore, Lucia intends to divide her forces into two parties: yours to pursue Thordan VII and draw the attention of the Heavens' Ward, and hers to rescue Ser Aymeric during the ensuing chaos. Temple Knights still loyal to the lord commander have secured the entrance to the Vault. Speak with the squire outside to confirm that the others are in position.

Once you and your companions make your entrance, the Temple Knight squire will send word to Lucia and the others, who stand ready to breach the underground gaol. See to your remaining preparations and commence the assault.

※Challenge the Vault with other players via the Duty Finder, or with a party of NPCs via Duty Support. Both systems are accessible from the main menu as well as the dungeon's entrance point.

After facing wave after wave of Temple Knights and the Heavens' Ward besides, you stand at the pinnacle of the Vault, unbowed. Unable to repel your advance, Ser Zephirin gives the order to retreat, and Ser Charibert reluctantly obeys. Frantically, you give chase, sensing that your chance to seize the archbishop is slipping away.

Rejoined by your companions and a wounded Ser Aymeric, you pursue Thordan VII, finally catching up with him as he prepares to board an airship and escape. After exchanging glances, you and Lord Haurchefant rush headlong towards the vessel─but in your haste to apprehend your quarry, you fail to notice a transformed Ser Zephirin taking aim at you, a spear of pure light in his hand. Alert to the danger, Lord Haurchefant bellows a warning and raises his shield in your defense, but the steel gives way, and the spear finds a mark...

The airship forgotten, you and the others surround Lord Haurchefant, who lies upon the ground struggling to breathe. As Ser Aymeric cradles him in his arms, the fallen knight looks to you with a mixture of agony and relief, and bids you favor him with a smile...before the light leaves his eyes forever.
Outside the Vault, the Temple Knight squire informs you that the others have gone on ahead to Fortemps Manor. Join them and together inform Count Edmont of his son's fate.

To serve; to protect; to sacrifice. There is no greater calling for a knight...or so Count Edmont labors to convince himself. Nothing you can say will be of comfort to him now. Go, and leave the count to mourn in private.

Alphinaud has ever prided himself on his words, but when faced with a grieving father, he could find none. As he reflects on the many ways in which Lord Haurchefant helped you in the past, he grows quiet once more, and turns to look away...
objectives: Speak with the Temple Knight squire outside the Vault.
Speak with the Temple Knight squire.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: We've been working in secret to undermine the Holy See and the High Houses. That much I'll acknowledge.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: But this nonsense about us throwing wide the gates for the heretics is just that: nonsense.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: If not you, then who?

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: You Temple Knights, of course. Reckoned it was your beloved Ser Aymeric's doing at first, but then I heard how he lost his head. My next best guess would be the Heavens' Ward.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: That way they'd have the perfect excuse to go door-to-door through the Brume. Slaughter the heretics and their “sympathizers” in one fell swoop.

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: But the Heavens' Ward's scheme did not account for Lady Iceheart's intervention...and so they have been forced to improvise.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: A fine bloody mess, ain't it? But the die is cast. So what's the plan?

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: We must divert the attention of the High Houses away from the city, and to do that, we need the cooperation of your allies in their service.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: ...And what makes you think I have friends in high places?

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: You would be fools not to, given your goals. Lowborn knights are ideal recruits.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Most swore fealty only out of desire for a better life. If offered an opportunity to shed the yoke and live for themselves, who among them would not at least be tempted to take it?

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Rare is the man eager to die for a cause he does not hold dear. But it need not come to that this day. If they and their fellow knights are deployed afield to deal with a new threat─a massing of heretics, for example─then they will be unable to join in the defense of the Vault.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Huh. Spread false reports of an attack to get 'em out of harm's way, you mean?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The city will not soon forget the heretics' last assault. If the High Houses believe another attack is imminent, they will have no choice but to act.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Can it be done?

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Can we trick them into leaving Ishgard? Aye. Can we keep them out for long? Not bloody likely. Make sure you're ready before I send word, because you won't get a second chance at this.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Then it is decided. To the Vault! The archbishop must be held to account!

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: And the lord commander granted his liberty!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I do not relish the thought of facing the Temple Knights in battle, but what other choice do we have?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: First Ser Grinnaux and Ser Paulecrain, and now this Charibert character... I mean, it makes you wonder, doesn't it? Are all the knights of the Heavens' Ward this bad?

dialogue.name: REVOLUTIONARY1
dialogue.text: Bugger me, if you ain't everythin' they say! How in the hells did you do that thing with the other thing!?

dialogue.name: REVOLUTIONARY2A
dialogue.text: Hoo hoo hoo! You didn't half give that highborn scum what for! That was a sight for sore eyes, that was!

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: Time is of the essence, Forename. We must move quickly, before they discern our intent!

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: I never liked him, not since his days as an inquisitor. He took far too much pleasure in his work.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Gods help me, I think we just might do this...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Did you see the way she wielded that weapon of hers? Maybe I should get one for my own protection...

dialogue.name: REVOLUTIONARY1
dialogue.text: So, er...what happens if we win?

dialogue.name: REVOLUTIONARY2A
dialogue.text: You seriously mean to attack the Vault, then, do you? As in, charge in there screaming and swinging steel? Bloody hells...

dialogue.name: HAURCHEFANT
dialogue.text: With allies such as these, we cannot fail!

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: One chance only, Forename. Make it count.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Hearken to me, everyone! We have two objectives: rescue Ser Aymeric and apprehend the archbishop. We will therefore divide our forces into two parties.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Estinien and I will make ready to breach the underground gaol and search for the lord commander. We will not move, however, until the second party has entered the Vault.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: I speak of your party, Warrior of Light, together with Lord Haurchefant and Master Alphinaud. For this plan to succeed, you will need to fight your way into the highest levels of the Vault, even unto the archbishop's private chambers. When the Heavens' Ward realize what you intend, they will fly to their master's side, leaving only a token force to guard the gaol.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Temple Knights loyal to our cause have already secured the entrance to the Vault. Once you are within, they will signal to us. If all goes to plan, we shall rejoin you with Ser Aymeric and confront the archbishop together.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Is everyone clear as to their duties? Then let us do what must needs be done!

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT01640
dialogue.text: The others are in position, MistressMaster Forename.

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT01640
dialogue.text: I will send word once you and your party have entered...

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT01640
dialogue.text: Godsspeed, madamsir. For Ser Aymeric, and for Ishgard.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: I wish I still had some blood pearls...

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT01640
dialogue.text: I...I know not what to say. The others, they...they are gathered at Fortemps Manor.

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT01640
dialogue.text: For what it is worth, MistressMaster Surname...my condolences.

dialogue.name: HOUSEFORTEMPSGUARD01580
dialogue.text: The others are... Please enter, MistressMaster Surname.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I...I could not stand there in silence, but...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: When all others had forsaken us, Lord Haurchefant took us in. Our beacon of hope in a world of darkness.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: He did his utmost to raise our spirits, so that we might face our troubles with courage. With conviction.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So that we might face them as...as knights...

dialogue.name: BUTLER01580
dialogue.text: My lord...

dialogue.name: HOUSEFORTEMPSSTEWARD
dialogue.text: What are we to do...?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: <sniffle> <sob> I'm sorry, I just...I can't...
